relatedBlades.htmlContent: Best practices for securely adopting generative AI with SASE Read blog >

relatedBlades.title: Secure hybrid work with Cloudflare
relatedBlades.subtitle: Explore specific hybrid work use cases that our cloud-native services can help you achieve.
relatedBlades.copy:
Securing hybrid work involves many security disciplines and requires attention and collaboration across your entire business. 

See how Cloudflare delivers on your use cases and simplifies key security processes.

contentfulAsset.description: Illustration of a person working from home with Cloudflare swag

relatedBlades.title: Cloudflare's connectivity cloud simplifies hybrid work security
relatedBlades.copy: Our composable platform and network make it easier to secure any connection, so users on any device in any location can stay safe and productive using the Internet, applications, and infrastructure.

columnContent.title: Simpler implementation
columnContent.description: Add new apps and users quickly with unified management, flexible on-ramps, and intuitive automation through API and Terraform.

columnContent.title: End user experience
columnContent.description: Deliver consistent, low-latency performance everywhere, with security services designed to run in all Cloudflare data centers.

columnContent.title: Agile architecture
columnContent.description: Enhance your SASE implementation more efficiently with one control plane and composable, cloud-native services that you can deploy in any order.

columnContent.title: Converged protection
columnContent.description: Consolidate existing point solutions for public and private traffic, and accelerate your efforts to modernize security and networking.

relatedBlades.description: How to evaluate SASE platforms for high-priority use cases

relatedBlades.htmlContent:
Canva uses Cloudflare to protects its
3500+ employee hybrid workforce

content.value: Canva needed an effective way to manage and protect application usage across its global user base of 3500 employees and multiple third-party agencies.
With Cloudflare Access, Cloudflare's ZTNA service, Canva's security teams find it much easier to onboard and offboard new users, and to track their network activity.

Cloudflare Access saved us from having to develop our own Identity and Access Management (IAM) system…we wanted to give employees different levels of permissions in CanvaWorld, and Access lets us do that easily."
